data.text: @EricCrampton @publicaddress Pretty stark. Someon could say "the date range goes back to September 2021, when peope weren't vaccinated at the levels quoted". But the hospitalisations of the most recent 4 weeks would dominate in this data anyway. Perhaps a similar chart starting at 1 February 2022?

@EricCrampton why are you quoting Plank? the inaccurate and naive British modeller still being investigated for his HIV botchup. vaccination is not a co-morbidity of covid. where are the age and obesity data? you are trying to make something of nonsense
@AndrewWhitsed @JMikeOJ @EricCrampton Yes, you really need to be looking at the per-capita rates now the different groups vary so much in size.

@JMikeOJ @EricCrampton Correct that data is of hospitalisations since the beginning of the Delta outbreak, though even looking at weekly cases unvaccinated disproportionately likely to be hospitalised
https://t.co/lIeB4axv2B

@EricCrampton U need 2 look @ the CHANGE. The data total shows 1727 in hosp. Really? There are ACTUALLY 618 in hosp. Measure the rate of change & U will find that of 570 new cases, over the week, (289) 51% were fully vaxed & (122) 21% were boosted, a total of 72%. Unvaxed are only (98) 17%.
@EricCrampton I would prefer if there were more granular & contextual information within that stat report, or how many are healthy vs immunocompromised or vulnerable at-risk etc...
